venue.address_1: Off route 302. .5 miles east of Dry River Campground
venue.name: Arethusa Falls Parking Lot

item.description:
Be prepared to hike with this group as a group our motto is: We go in as a group and we come out as a group. We will hike at a pace of our slowest hiker.

We all have our own individual pace. Our organizers offer levels of hiking to give you options so you can hike at a level and pace that is comfortable for you.



A half day hike location between Bartlett and Twin Mountain
Length: 4.5 mile loop
Difficulty: Moderate
Elevation gain: 620 feet to water fall (frozen); 1,280 feet for full loop

Arethusa Falls is New Hampshire's highest falls and views of Crawford Notch from the top of Frankenstein Cliff

Finding the trail head: From the junction of U.S. highway 3 and 302 in twin Mountain,turn east on US 302 and continue to Crawford Notch.
The Driveway to the Arethusa Falls leaves the right (west) side of the highway 3.2 miles south of the Willey House. The large gravel area to the right is for spill -over parking . Continue 0.2 mile uphill on the paved driveway to reach a smaller parking lot at the Arethusa Falls Trailhead.
item.name: Arethusa Falls Trail and Frankenstein Cliffs
